title: Shernfire returns to Australia as Riot competitive ruling looms

embed.description: One of Oceania's best up-and-coming players is having his American sojourn cut short after getting banned for elo boosting. The jungler for North American Challenger side Vortex, Shern "Shernfire" Tai, has left the Team Coast gaming house and returned to his home in Australia, sources close to the organizations tell the Daily Dot.

replies.body: I didn't even know there is an Australian competing at an overseas' league.

Theres actually a few.

Most don't go over because they have Uni


**Keane** plays for gravity the number 1 team in NA atm
**Veritas** (played for AV)
**Sherfire** Team coast

i'm pretty sure there are a few players who are in the high elo range (dimond 1 90lp+) on NA as well.
Raydere also got offered Veritas's spot..... Mechanically alot of our players are up there with the main regions.... Its just the teamplay and strategic play which we're behind with
